intro: Dischidia subpelligera, commonly known as the hairy vine or woolly fig, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often fleshy stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Dischidia subpelligera is well adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks in its natural habitat.
